descriptions: NOTES

subLabels.text: Meaning and setting for health education
Cells and tissues of human body
Formation of tissues, organs and systems

descriptions: Students should visit to observe community, health facility and work place base, health education programmes and services.
Differences between growth and development should be emphasized.
The three different types of muscles should be discussed in relation to their functions.
Emphasis should be on synovial joint.
Location of the different types of joint should be identified.
Specific examples should be used to illustrate the classes of levers.

subLabels.text: Candidates should examine the heart of a dissected mammal

descriptions: Pulse rate should be counted.  The web of a toad/frog should be examined with a hand lens to observe the capillaries.  The importance of lymph nodes should be mentioned.
Prepared slides of blood should be observed under microscope. Pulmonary and systemic circulation should be emphasized.

subLabels.text: Blood groups, rhesus factors hemoglobin, genotype
descriptions: The relevance of these factors in relation to blood transfusion should be mentioned.

subLabels.text: Diseases disorder of the circulatory system and their causes; sickle cell anaemia, leukaemia, haemophilia arteriosclerosis, hypertension, coronary thrombosis and stroke
descriptions: Heredity aspect of sickle cell andhaemophilia should be discussed.
Prevention of anaemia and arteriosclerosis should be discussed.

subLabels.text: Organs of the digestive system and their functions
descriptions: Candidates should examine the alimentary canal of a dissected mammal.The location and function of accessory organs of digestion should be emphasized.
Digestive enzymes should be discussed in relation to substrates and end-product.

subLabels.text: Mentioned should be made of tissue respiration in relation to metabolism. osmosis and diffusion should be demonstrated and their importance in absorption should be emphasized
Structure and functions of the kidney and skin
Structure and functions of the respiratory system

descriptions: respiration.

subLabels.text: The brain, spinal cord and nerves should be discussed
Structure and functions of the components of the nervous system

descriptions: Body temperature, blood sugar level, water balance, electrolytes balance, pH and blood pressure should be highlighted. Candidates should test urine with litmus paper and also, count pulse rate. Mention should be made of the positive and negative feed back control system.

subLabels.text: Location of the different endocrine glands, the hormones produced and their functions

descriptions: Posture should be related to the following: sitting; standing; walking and lifting.
The roles of nutrition and exercise as determinants of correct posture should be discussed.
The causes of postural defects e.g. habits, accidents, heredity and diseases should be discussed.

subLabels.text: Flat foot; scoliosis, kyphosis and lordosis
Physical appearance, position and functions of body organs
Structure and functions of the different types of teeth should be discussed
Dental caries and gingivitis should be mentioned
Goals and objectives. linkages for promotion (initiatives)
Meaning different aspects of family health

descriptions: Effects of poor sanitation and pest infestation in home should be discussed.

subLabels.text: Mention should include drug abuse, drug dependence, drug misuse, drug addiction, self medication, alcoholism, rehabilitation this should include oral, injection, inhalation, topical and anal. prevention of drug abuse should be highlighted

descriptions: The need for health insurance schemes should be stressed. Students  should be able to identify to differentiate between pests and vectors.
Tests for starch, simple and complex sugars, proteins and fats should be carried out. Local example of sources of food nutrients should be mentioned.
Negative and positive effects should be stressed.  Nutritional value of non- alcoholic beverages should be stressed.
Charts should be used to show diets for the different groups of people.
Candidates should be able to distinguish between family planning and safe motherhood.
Candidates should be able to distinguish between population and census.
Advantages of accurate census should be discussed.
Meaning and the interrelationship between emotional health and social health should be discussed.
The attributes of emotional and social health should be discussed.
Candidates should be able to identify personal problems and proffer solutions.

subLabels.text: Consumer health products and services laws protecting the consumer
descriptions: Various agencies promoting consumers health should be discussed.
Mention features of genuine products and services
The importance of checking label expiry dates on products before purchase should be highlighted.

subLabels.text: Factors influencing choice of consumer products; authencity; cost; availability; accessibility; availability and advertisement. consumer health care services
descriptions: Various types of health services: traditional medicine, orthodox medicine, alternative methods of healing (acupuncture, yoga and faith healing) should be discussed.
Different types of quackery such as mechanical, electrical, drug and cosmetic and medical quackery should be discussed

subLabels.text: Materials needed in health education laboratory/examination
Models of various organs of the body
Models of various parts of the body e.g. tooth
Reagents for testing of starch, protein, fat
Posters/charts of systems of the body e.g. reproductive, digestive, excretory
Photographs of health facilities and  workers e.g. doctors , nurses, dentist at work
Photographs of methods of sewage and refuse disposals
Photographs/posters of various types of communicable and non-communicable diseases
Model/poster showing parts of the body
Materials for personal hygiene e.g. toothpaste, comb, toothbrush
Photographs/posters showing methods of food preservation
Real objects/photographs/poster/charts of classes of food
Poster/real object of sphygmomanometer, thermometer, litmus paper snellen chart
In section b, all questions other than those on basic principles of literary appreciation will be on the set books for paper 2
